result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Jarrel Jones

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:11 PM Defendant Michael Jarrel Jones in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Kelly J. Freeman in person.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.

Activity:  Initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:34 PM Defendant Michael Jarrel Jones in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Kelly J. Freeman by video.  David S Olson and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Cash bond set for $2,000 with conditions:  No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.F., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No possession of weapons. Must remain in residence between the hours of 6pm and 6am.  Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendant requests Preliminary hearing within time limits and in person.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
